home.benefitsIntro: Imagine: Your child stays on task without constant reminders, you nail meeting priorities effortlessly, and finally get lost in that book you've been meaning to read. That's the power of trained focus.
home.familyLifeDesc: Help kids complete homework faster with fewer distractions. Be fully present during family time without mental clutter.
home.workPerformanceDesc: Say goodbye to zoning out in meetings. Achieve flow state faster and handle complex tasks with crystal-clear thinking.
home.personalGrowthDesc: Whether learning new skills or pursuing hobbies, strong focus helps you make progress twice as fast.
home.dailyPractice: Just 10 minutes daily - it's like weightlifting for your brain.

categories.title: Categories
categories.heading: Game Categories
categories.description: Browse our collection of brain training games by cognitive skill category. Each category focuses on a different aspect of mental performance.
categories.metaDescription: Browse our brain training games organized by cognitive skill category. Find games targeting memory, attention, reaction time, and spatial skills.
categories.metaKeywords: brain training categories, cognitive skills, memory games, focus games, attention games, reaction time games, cognitive flexibility
categories.ogDescription: Explore our categorized collection of brain games designed to enhance specific cognitive abilities.

categoryDescriptions.working-memory: Games that strengthen your ability to temporarily hold and manipulate information. Strong working memory helps students remember instructions, professionals juggle multiple tasks, and everyone follow conversations better.
categoryDescriptions.visual-tracking: Games that enhance your ability to follow moving objects and maintain visual focus. Better visual tracking helps readers avoid line-skipping, drivers track multiple vehicles, and athletes follow fast-moving balls.
categoryDescriptions.sustained-attention: Games that build your ability to maintain focus over extended periods. Enhanced sustained attention helps students stay engaged during long lectures, professionals maintain productivity throughout the workday, and everyone complete tasks without mental wandering.
categoryDescriptions.selective-attention: Games that improve your ability to focus on relevant information while filtering out distractions. Better selective attention helps students study in noisy environments, professionals concentrate in busy offices, and everyone maintain focus despite interruptions.
categoryDescriptions.divided-attention: Games that develop your ability to effectively split attention between multiple tasks or stimuli. Enhanced divided attention helps parents monitor children while completing household tasks, professionals handle concurrent responsibilities, and drivers safely navigate while being aware of surroundings.
categoryDescriptions.reaction-time: Games that sharpen your speed of response to visual or auditory stimuli. Faster reaction time helps athletes perform better, drivers respond quickly to road hazards, and older adults prevent falls.
categoryDescriptions.cognitive-flexibility: Games that enhance your ability to switch between different concepts or adapt to changing rules. Greater cognitive flexibility helps students apply knowledge across subjects, professionals adapt to changing work requirements, and everyone navigate social situations more effectively.
categoryDescriptions.spatial-memory: Games that strengthen your ability to remember and manipulate spatial information. Strong spatial memory helps with navigation, remembering object locations, understanding maps, and visualizing 3D structures. This skill is crucial for activities like parking, finding items, following directions, and excelling in STEM fields.

games.description: Discover our free focus-enhancing games, crafted to sharpen your attention and concentration with fun, targeted challenges.

aboutBrainTraining.title: About Brain Training
aboutBrainTraining.paragraph1: Cognitive training, often called brain training, involves regular mental exercises designed to improve specific cognitive functions like memory, attention, processing speed, and problem-solving abilities.
aboutBrainTraining.paragraph2: Our games are designed based on principles from cognitive psychology and neuroscience. Each game targets specific cognitive skills that are important for everyday functioning, academic success, and professional performance.
aboutBrainTraining.paragraph3: For best results, we recommend regular practice across different cognitive domains. Training for just 15-20 minutes a day, 3-4 times per week can lead to noticeable improvements in your cognitive abilities over time.

schulteTable.title: Schulte Table
schulteTable.subtitle: Supercharge Your Reading Speed and Visual Focus
schulteTable.description: Transform your reading and attention abilities with this classic cognitive exercise. Find numbers in sequence while training your peripheral vision and processing speed. Used by speed readers and professionals worldwide to enhance visual performance and concentration.
schulteTable.howToPlay: Find and click numbers in ascending order (1-25) as quickly as possible. Try to use your peripheral vision instead of scanning each number!

speedStandards.title: Speed Standards
speedStandards.intro: Here are the reference standards for a 5x5 (1-25) Schulte Table test:

schulteTable.metaTitle: Schulte Table - Peripheral Vision & Attention Training Game
schulteTable.metaDescription: Improve your peripheral vision, attention span, and reading speed with the Schulte Table exercise. Find numbers in sequence while training your brain to process visual information faster.
schulteTable.metaKeywords: schulte table exercise, peripheral vision training, visual attention game, speed reading practice, number sequence game, visual processing training, attention span improvement, cognitive speed exercise
schulteTable.ogTitle: Schulte Table - Train Your Peripheral Vision & Attention
schulteTable.ogDescription: Challenge yourself to find numbers in sequence while developing faster visual processing. Scientifically proven to enhance reading speed and attention.

science.title: Visual Attention and Processing Speed Enhancement
science.description: The Schulte Table is a well-established neuropsychological tool used to assess and train visual attention, processing speed, and executive function. Research shows that regular practice strengthens neural networks responsible for visual scanning, selective attention, and information processing speed - skills crucial for reading, driving, and academic performance.
science.blogArticleTitle: How to Improve Focus and Concentration: Science-Based Strategies

authorityLinks.attention: Visual attention and selective attention research overview
authorityLinks.speedReading: Scientific evidence for peripheral vision training and reading improvement

focusTraining.title: Focus Training
focusTraining.description: Enhance concentration and attention span through systematic visual search exercises.

readingSpeed.title: Reading Speed
readingSpeed.description: Develop faster reading skills by training your eyes to capture more information at once.

howItWorks.question: How does the Schulte Table work?
howItWorks.answer: The Schulte Table trains your brain to process visual information more efficiently by forcing you to maintain focus while using peripheral vision to locate numbers quickly.

bestPractice.question: What is the best way to practice?
bestPractice.answer: Try to keep your eyes fixed on the center of the table and use your peripheral vision to spot numbers. Practice daily for 10-15 minutes for best results.

readingHelp.question: How does this help with reading speed?
readingHelp.answer: By training your peripheral vision, you can perceive more text at once while reading. This reduces the number of eye movements needed, allowing you to process information faster and read more efficiently.

research.question: Is this exercise backed by research?
research.answer: Yes, the Schulte Table has been used in cognitive psychology for decades. Research shows it effectively improves visual attention, processing speed, and can help with conditions like ADHD by strengthening attention networks.

peripheralVision.question: What is peripheral vision and why is it important?
peripheralVision.answer: Peripheral vision is your ability to perceive information at the edges of your visual field without looking directly at it. It's crucial in daily life for activities like driving (noticing surrounding vehicles), reading (capturing more text at once), and sports (being aware of teammates' positions). Strong peripheral vision improves your spatial awareness, reaction time, and ability to distribute attention effectively.

dualNBack.title: Dual N-Back
dualNBack.subtitle: Elite Working Memory Training for Peak Cognitive Performance
dualNBack.description: Master the gold standard of brain training. This scientifically-proven exercise challenges you to track both visual positions and audio letters simultaneously, building the mental muscle that powers learning, focus, and intelligent thinking.
dualNBack.howToPlayIntro: In this game, you'll be presented with a sequence of stimuli - positions in a grid and letters. Your task is to identify when the current stimulus matches the one from N steps back. Press the position button when the position matches, and the sound button when the letter matches.
dualNBack.howToPlay1: Watch the grid and listen to the letter
dualNBack.howToPlay2: Press the position button when the position matches
dualNBack.howToPlay3: Press the sound button when the letter matches.
dualNBack.howToPlay4: As you improve, the N-back level will increase, making the task more challenging.

workingMemory.title: Working Memory
workingMemory.description: Improve your ability to hold and manipulate multiple pieces of information in mind while tracking positions and sounds.

fluidIntelligence.title: Fluid Intelligence
fluidIntelligence.description: Improve your problem-solving abilities and cognitive flexibility through the challenging dual-task nature of the mahjong n-back exercise.

attentionControl.title: Attention Control
attentionControl.description: Enhance your focus and ability to filter out distractions while monitoring both visual and auditory mahjong stimuli simultaneously.

science.title: Working Memory and Fluid Intelligence Enhancement
science.description: The Dual N-Back task is one of the most researched cognitive training exercises. Studies have shown that regular practice can improve working memory capacity and may enhance fluid intelligence - your ability to reason and solve novel problems. The task challenges your brain's central executive system by requiring simultaneous processing of visual and auditory information streams.
science.blogArticleTitle: The Science Behind N-Back Training: How This Game Actually Boosts Your Working Memory

authorityLinks.jaeggi: Landmark study showing dual n-back training can improve fluid intelligence
authorityLinks.wikipedia: Comprehensive overview of working memory research and theories
authorityLinks.cognitiveTraining: Detailed analysis of dual n-back training effectiveness and methodology

science.question: What is N-Back?
science.answer: N-Back is a cognitive task where you must remember what happened N steps ago in a sequence. For example, in a 2-Back task, you need to remember what was shown 2 steps previously.

practice.question: How often should I practice?
practice.answer: For optimal results, try to practice 20-30 minutes per day, 4-5 days per week. Consistency is more important than duration.

progress.question: How do I know if I'm improving?
progress.answer: As you improve, you'll be able to increase the N-Back level (from 1-back to 2-back, 3-back, etc.) while maintaining accuracy. Your reaction time will also improve.

challenging.question: How challenging is this game?
challenging.answer: This game is designed to be challenging. It's a great way to improve your attention and working memory.

improvements.question: How will this improve my life?
improvements.answer: This game is a great way to improve your attention and working memory. It's a fun way to train your brain.

mahjongDualNBack.title: Mahjong Dual N-Back
mahjongDualNBack.subtitle: Advanced working memory training with traditional mahjong tiles
mahjongDualNBack.description: A variant of Dual N-Back using mahjong tiles and sounds to train working memory and cognitive skills.
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlayIntro: In this challenging memory task inspired by traditional Mahjong, you'll need to remember both the tile patterns and audio stimuli from N steps back in the sequence:
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlay1: Watch as mahjong tiles appear in sequence on the teal felt table
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlay2: Press "Tile Match" when the current tile matches the tile from N steps back
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlay3: Press "Sound Match" when the current sound matches the sound from N steps back
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlay4: Use keyboard shortcuts: 'A' for Tile Match, 'L' for Sound Match
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlay5: Start with 1-back (remembering the previous tile) and progress to higher levels as your memory improves
mahjongDualNBack.howToPlay6: Adjust settings to customize your training experience with different N-back levels and stimulus types

workingMemory.title: Working Memory
workingMemory.description: Strengthen your ability to hold and manipulate multiple pieces of information in mind while tracking mahjong tile positions and sounds.

fluidIntelligence.title: Fluid Intelligence
fluidIntelligence.description: Improve your problem-solving abilities and cognitive flexibility through the challenging dual-task nature of the mahjong n-back exercise.

attentionControl.title: Attention Control
attentionControl.description: Enhance your focus and ability to filter out distractions while monitoring both visual and auditory mahjong stimuli simultaneously.

science.question: What is the science behind Mahjong Dual N-Back?
science.answer: Dual N-Back has been studied extensively in cognitive neuroscience. Research published in PNAS (2008) suggested that training with this task can improve fluid intelligence. Our mahjong-themed version combines position and audio matching with traditional mahjong aesthetics to create an engaging cognitive workout.

difference.question: How is this different from the regular Dual N-Back?
difference.answer: While maintaining the core dual n-back mechanics of tracking position and audio stimuli, our version incorporates authentic mahjong tiles and a traditional green felt background. This cultural theming makes the exercise more visually engaging while preserving the cognitive challenge that makes dual n-back effective.

practice.question: How often should I practice with the mahjong tiles?
practice.answer: For optimal results, aim for 20-30 minutes of mahjong dual n-back training, 3-4 times per week. Consistency is more important than duration. Regular practice helps your brain build stronger neural pathways for working memory tasks involving both visual position and auditory processing.

improvements.question: Will I see improvements in my daily life from mahjong memory training?
improvements.answer: Many users report improvements in concentration, multitasking ability, and information retention after regular practice with dual n-back exercises. The position and audio tracking skills developed here can transfer to academic, professional, and everyday activities requiring attention to multiple streams of information.

knowledge.question: Do I need to know how to play mahjong to use this training game?
knowledge.answer: No prior knowledge of mahjong is required. While we use the beautiful visual elements of traditional mahjong tiles, the cognitive task focuses on remembering positions and sounds rather than mahjong gameplay. The exercise is designed to be accessible to everyone regardless of their familiarity with mahjong.

selectiveAttention.title: Selective Attention
selectiveAttention.description: Develop your ability to focus on relevant stimuli while ignoring distractions.

visualTracking.question: How does visual tracking training benefit everyday life?
visualTracking.answer: Strong visual tracking skills are essential for reading, driving, sports, and navigating busy environments. This training can help improve performance in all these areas.

children.question: Is this suitable for children?
children.answer: Yes! This game is excellent for children and adults alike. Visual tracking training is particularly beneficial for developing readers and those with attention difficulties.

trainingDuration.question: How long should each training session be?
trainingDuration.answer: Aim for 10-15 minute sessions. Quality of attention is more important than duration - it's better to do shorter sessions with full concentration than longer ones with diminished focus.

readingDifficulties.question: Can this help with reading difficulties?
readingDifficulties.answer: Yes, many reading difficulties are connected to visual tracking problems. Regular practice with this game may help improve reading fluency and comprehension by strengthening the visual tracking system.

sequentialMemory.question: How does sequential memory help in daily life?
sequentialMemory.answer: Sequential memory is crucial for following directions, learning new skills, remembering phone numbers, and executing multi-step tasks. It's fundamental to many aspects of learning and daily functioning.

ageGroups.question: Is this game suitable for all ages?
ageGroups.answer: Yes! This game is designed to be engaging for children and challenging for adults. The progressive difficulty ensures that players of all ages and abilities can benefit.

practiceTips.question: How often should I practice?
practiceTips.answer: For best results, practice for 10-15 minutes daily. Consistent, regular practice is more effective than occasional longer sessions.

learningDifficulties.question: Can this help with learning difficulties?
learningDifficulties.answer: Yes, many learning difficulties involve challenges with sequential processing and working memory. Regular practice with this game may help strengthen these cognitive skills.

mathSkills.question: How does this help with math skills?
mathSkills.answer: This game trains the fundamental cognitive processes that underlie mathematical thinking: quick number recognition, magnitude comparison, and decision-making. These skills form the foundation for more complex math abilities.

children.question: Is this good for children learning math?
children.answer: Yes! This game helps develop number sense, which is crucial for early math development. It's especially helpful for children who are learning to compare quantities and understand numerical relationships.

processingSpeed.question: How does processing speed affect learning?
processingSpeed.answer: Processing speed affects how quickly you can take in, understand, and respond to information. Faster processing allows you to handle more complex tasks efficiently and reduces cognitive load during learning activities.

adults.question: Can adults benefit from this training?
adults.answer: Absolutely. Processing speed can decline with age, and regular training can help maintain or improve this cognitive function. This game provides a quick, engaging way to exercise these neural pathways.

dailyLife.question: How does visual pattern memory help in daily life?
dailyLife.answer: Visual pattern memory is essential for navigation, recognizing faces, learning new information through diagrams or charts, and many professional skills from reading X-rays to architectural design.

learning.question: Can this improve my ability to learn new things?
learning.answer: Yes! Strong visual memory helps you retain information presented in visual formats, which is how much of our learning occurs. This skill transfers to academic learning, professional development, and acquiring new hobbies.

consistency.title: Track Consistency
consistency.description: Record multiple test results to see the consistency and variation in your reaction times.

what.question: What is reaction time?
what.answer: Reaction time is the interval between perceiving a stimulus (like seeing the screen turn green) and making a physical response (like clicking). It includes the time your brain takes to process visual information, decide to act, and send signals to your muscles. Average human reaction time to visual stimuli is typically between 200-250 milliseconds, though this varies by individual and circumstances.

limitations.question: What are the limitations of this test?
limitations.answer: This test only measures simple reaction time, not choice reaction time or complex decision-making. Results are affected by hardware (monitor refresh rate, mouse/touchscreen latency), environmental factors, and personal state (like fatigue level), so it shouldn't be considered a precise scientific measurement.

factors.question: What factors affect reaction time?
factors.answer: Many factors influence reaction time, including age (typically peaks in your 20s and gradually lengthens afterward), sleep quality, attention level, diet, medications, fatigue, and alertness during testing. Your hardware also affects measurements, with gaming monitors and professional equipment potentially providing faster results than typical devices.

significance.question: What's the significance of reaction time testing?
significance.answer: Reaction time testing provides a way to understand your basic neural response speed. It can serve as a personal baseline but shouldn't be viewed as a training tool. If you notice your reaction time becoming significantly slower, it may be an indicator of fatigue, distraction, or other health factors. For professional competitors or certain occupations, understanding reaction time may have reference value.

gameUI.instructions: When the blue screen turns green, click as quickly as you can! Complete 5 rounds to get your average score.
gameUI.hardwareNote: Note: Your results depend on your device's hardware, display lag, and input processing time.
gameUI.screenReaderWaiting: Waiting for blue screen to turn green. Do not click yet.
gameUI.screenReaderReady: Screen is now green. Click immediately!
gameUI.hardwareFactorsNote: Results vary by device. Gaming monitors, mice, and computers can impact measurements by up to 30-50ms.

spatialMemory.title: Spatial Memory

howToPlay.question: How do I play the counting boxes game?
howToPlay.answer: Watch as 3D cubes briefly appear on a grid, remember how many you saw, and enter the correct count. The game progressively increases difficulty with more cubes and complex patterns.

difficulty.question: How does the difficulty change?
difficulty.answer: Early levels feature 3-4 cubes in simple patterns, while advanced levels include up to 23 cubes in complex arrangements. Some levels add animations like fly-in effects to increase the challenge.

benefits.question: What cognitive benefits does this provide?
benefits.answer: This game trains working memory, spatial processing, selective attention, and visual tracking - skills that transfer to mathematics, navigation, professional tasks, and everyday spatial reasoning.

practice.question: How often should I practice?
practice.answer: For optimal results, practice 10-15 minutes daily. The progressive difficulty system ensures appropriate challenge levels as your spatial memory skills improve.

gameUI.howMany: How many boxes did you see?

encouragement.perfect: Perfect! You are a box memory master!
encouragement.great: Great! Practice a few more times and you'll be even better!
encouragement.good: Nice! Keep working hard, your memory will get better and better!
encouragement.keepTrying: Don't be discouraged, practice more and you will definitely improve!

stroopEffectTest.title: Stroop Effect Test
stroopEffectTest.subtitle: Challenge your brain with color-word conflicts
stroopEffectTest.description: Test your cognitive flexibility by identifying colors that conflict with the words. Train your selective attention and conflict resolution skills.

metadata.title: Stroop Effect Test | Free Cognitive Flexibility Training
metadata.description: Experience the famous Stroop effect with our free online test. Improve cognitive flexibility and selective attention by identifying colors that conflict with words.
metadata.keywords: stroop effect test, cognitive flexibility training, selective attention test, color word conflict, brain training, psychology test, stroop task, attention training, cognitive interference test, free online stroop test
metadata.ogTitle: Stroop Effect Test - Train Your Cognitive Flexibility
metadata.ogDescription: Challenge your brain with the classic Stroop effect test. Identify colors while ignoring conflicting word meanings.

howToPlay.description: In this cognitive flexibility test, you'll identify the color of words, not what the words say.
howToPlay.step1: Look at the colored word displayed on screen
howToPlay.step2: Identify the COLOR of the text, not the meaning of the word
howToPlay.step3: Click the correct color button or press the number key (1-6)
howToPlay.step4: Complete 20 trials to see your Stroop effect measurement

cognitiveFlexibility.title: Cognitive Flexibility
cognitiveFlexibility.description: Enhance your ability to switch between different mental concepts and adapt to changing rules or demands.

selectiveAttention.title: Selective Attention
selectiveAttention.description: Improve your ability to focus on relevant information while filtering out conflicting or distracting elements.

conflictResolution.title: Conflict Resolution
conflictResolution.description: Train your brain to resolve conflicts between competing information sources and make accurate decisions under interference.

whatIsStroop.question: What is the Stroop effect?
whatIsStroop.answer: The Stroop effect is a phenomenon where it takes longer to identify the color of a word when the word's meaning conflicts with its color (e.g., the word 'RED' printed in blue). This demonstrates how automatic reading processes can interfere with color identification.

whyDifficult.question: Why is this test difficult?
whyDifficult.answer: Reading is such an automatic process that your brain naturally wants to process the word's meaning first. When the word says 'GREEN' but is colored red, your brain has to work harder to ignore the word meaning and focus only on the color.

howToImprove.question: How can I improve my performance?
howToImprove.answer: Practice regularly to strengthen your selective attention skills. Try to develop strategies like focusing on the color immediately without reading the word, or using peripheral vision to see the color without processing the text.

realWorldApps.question: How does this apply to real life?
realWorldApps.answer: The cognitive skills trained in the Stroop test transfer to many real-world situations requiring selective attention, such as driving (ignoring distractions), studying (focusing amid noise), or work (concentrating on priorities despite interruptions).

gameUI.title: Stroop Effect Test

gameUI.stroopEffectDescription: Difference between incongruent and congruent trials
gameUI.shareText: I completed the Stroop Effect Test

babyAnimalMatching.title: Baby Animal Matching Game
babyAnimalMatching.subtitle: Adorable Memory Training for All Ages
babyAnimalMatching.description: Match pairs of cute baby animals in this classic memory card game. Improves visual memory and concentration for all ages.
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayIntro: Find all the matching pairs of baby animals in this memory card game!
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep1: Select your difficulty level to start
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep2: Click on a card to flip it over and reveal a baby animal
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep3: Click on a second card to find its matching pair
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep4: If the animals match, the cards stay face up
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep5: If they don't match, they flip back over after a moment
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep6: Remember card positions to find matches faster
babyAnimalMatching.howToPlayStep7: Match all pairs in the fewest moves to win!
babyAnimalMatching.benefit1_desc: Challenges your ability to hold and manipulate visual information in your mind.
babyAnimalMatching.benefit2_desc: Improves speed and accuracy in recognizing and differentiating visual patterns.
babyAnimalMatching.benefit3_desc: Strengthens your focus and attention span by requiring you to remember card locations.
babyAnimalMatching.faq1_question: Is this baby animal matching game suitable for young children?
babyAnimalMatching.faq1_answer: Yes! The simple rules, cute animal visuals, and adjustable difficulty levels make it perfect for children as young as 3-4 years old with parental guidance.
babyAnimalMatching.faq2_question: How does difficulty affect the baby animal matching game?
babyAnimalMatching.faq2_answer: The game offers multiple difficulty levels: Easy (3x2 grid with 3 pairs), Medium (4x2 grid with 4 pairs), Hard (4x3 grid with 6 pairs), and Expert (4x4 grid with 8 pairs). Higher difficulties require remembering more card positions.
babyAnimalMatching.faq3_question: What cognitive benefits does this memory matching game provide?
babyAnimalMatching.faq3_answer: This game enhances working memory, visual recognition, pattern matching skills, and concentration. Regular play can improve focus and attention to detail in both children and adults.

assessment.title: Memory Assessment
assessment.description: Get an objective measure of your short-term verbal memory capacity using scientifically-based methodology.

tracking.title: Progress Tracking
tracking.description: Monitor changes in your memory performance over time and identify patterns in your cognitive abilities.

comparison.title: Population Comparison
comparison.description: Compare your performance against age and gender-matched peers to understand your relative memory strength.

what.question: What does this memory test measure?
what.answer: This test measures your short-term verbal memory capacity - specifically your ability to encode, store, and recall word phrases within a brief time period. It's similar to standardized memory assessments used in cognitive research.

howLong.question: How long does the test take?
howLong.answer: The entire test takes about 2-3 minutes. You can study the items at your own pace, then recall them in the input boxes (most people finish within 2-3 minutes).

scoring.question: How is the score calculated?
scoring.answer: Your score is based on the percentage of word phrases correctly recalled. Optional demographic information allows for age and gender-adjusted percentile rankings compared to research populations.

accuracy.question: How accurate is this test?
accuracy.answer: While this test uses established memory assessment principles, it's designed for educational purposes. For clinical or formal assessments, consult with qualified professionals who use standardized testing protocols.

improve.question: Can this test help improve my memory?
improve.answer: This is primarily an assessment tool, not a training program. However, understanding your baseline can help you track changes over time and identify if memory training or lifestyle changes are beneficial.

instruction.description: Test your short-term memory by memorizing and recalling word phrases.
instruction.step1: 12 word phrases will be shown for 20 seconds
instruction.step2: Memorize as many as you can

freeShortTermMemoryTest.studyAtYourPace: Take your time to study these words carefully

recall.title: Recall Phase
recall.gridInstruction: Fill in the word phrases you remember in any of the boxes below. You don't need to remember the exact order.
recall.placeholder: Type the word phrases here, separated by commas or new lines...

setup.title: Get Personalized Results
setup.description: Provide your age group and gender to receive personalized scoring compared to your demographic group.

results.title: Your Memory Test Results
results.excellent: Excellent performance! You have outstanding memory skills.
results.good: Good performance! Your memory skills are above average.
results.keepPracticing: Keep practicing! Regular training can improve your memory.
results.encouragement: Great effort! Memory is like a muscle - the more you exercise it, the stronger it becomes.
results.trainingTip: Try to practice memory exercises 10-15 minutes daily for best results. Consistency is key to improvement!
